# List of international cricket centuries by Rohit Sharma

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/28/2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Sharma_%2801%29_%28cropped%29.JPG/220px-2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Sharma_%2801%29_%28cropped%29.JPG)](/wiki/File:2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Sharma_\(01\)_\(cropped\).JPG)

[](/wiki/File:2015_CWC_I_v_UAE_02-28_Sharma_\(01\)_\(cropped\).JPG "Enlarge")

Rohit Sharma has scored 24 centuries in [Test cricket](/wiki/Test_cricket
"Test cricket"), [One Day Internationals](/wiki/One_Day_International "One Day
International") and [Twenty20 Internationals](/wiki/Twenty20_International
"Twenty20 International").

[Rohit Sharma](/wiki/Rohit_Sharma "Rohit Sharma") is an Indian
[cricketer](/wiki/Cricket "Cricket") and a right-handed top order batsman.[1]
He has made 24 [centuries](/wiki/Century_\(cricket\) "Century \(cricket\)") in
international cricket—18 in [One Day
Internationals](/wiki/One_Day_International "One Day International") (ODI), 3
in [Test cricket](/wiki/Test_cricket "Test cricket") and 3 in
[T20I](/wiki/T20I "T20I") cricket—as of July 2018.

Rohit made his ODI debut against [Ireland](/wiki/Ireland_national_cricket_team
"Ireland national cricket team") in June 2007. He scored his first century in
2010 when he made 114 against the
[Zimbabwe](/wiki/Zimbabwe_national_cricket_team "Zimbabwe national cricket
team") at [Queens Sports Club](/wiki/Queens_Sports_Club "Queens Sports Club"),
[Bulawayo](/wiki/Bulawayo "Bulawayo"). He made his Test cricket debut against
the West Indies in 2013 and scored his first Test century, thus became the
14th Indian to score his century in debut test match.[2] He made back to back
centuries in [ that
series](/wiki/West_Indian_cricket_team_in_India_in_2013%E2%80%9314 "West
Indian cricket team in India in 2013–14") and won man of the series.[3]

His highest score of 264, which is an all-time record in ODIs as of December
2017, was made against [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka "Sri Lanka") at the [Eden
Gardens](/wiki/Eden_Gardens "Eden Gardens"), [Kolkata](/wiki/Kolkata
"Kolkata"), in November 2014.[4] In December 2017, he became the first player
to score three double centuries in ODIs when he scored 208 not out against the
same team.

On 2 October 2015 Rohit Sharma became the second Indian to make a century in
T20I cricket.[5] He is the first batsman for India and second overall to
[score three centuries in
T20Is](/wiki/List_of_centuries_in_Twenty20_International_cricket "List of
centuries in Twenty20 International cricket").[6]

Away  | The match was played in opponent's country   
Neutral  | The match was played neither in India nor in the opponent's country
